com.github.javactic.futures

Interface OrFuture<G,B>

  • Type Parameters:
    G - the success type
    B - the failure type

    public interface OrFuture<G,B>

    The interface for disjunction futures. OrFutures do not succeed or fail, they complete with an instance of Or.

    OrFutures created with the factory methods on this interface will not handle exceptions thrown by the provided suppliers. Depending on the Executor used these exceptions might be handled by the Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler or printed to the standard error output by the ThreadGroup.uncaughtException(Thread, Throwable) method. To avoid problems with uncaught exceptions, use a FutureFactory to create OrFuture instances that will transform uncaught exceptions into instances of Bad.

     throws TimeoutException,
            InterruptedException
        Returns the result of this future, waiting at most the given duration.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the result of this future
        Throws:
        TimeoutException - if the result was not available within the given timeout
        InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting

      • get

        Or<G,B> get(Duration timeout,
            B timeoutBad)
     throws InterruptedException
        Returns the result of this future, waiting at most the given duration, or returns the a Bad containing the given timeoutBad.
        Parameters:
        timeout - the duration to wait for the result
        timeoutBad - the failure to return if the timeout expired
        Returns:
        the result of this future or a Bad containing the given value
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current thread was interrupted while waiting

      • flatMap

        default <H> OrFuture<H,B> flatMap(Function<? super G,? extends OrFuture<? extends H,? extends B>> mapper)
        Creates a new future by applying a function to the result of this future if it is a Good, and returns the result of the function as the new future. If this future completes with a Bad, the new future returns the Bad.
        Type Parameters:
        H - the type of the mapped Good
        Parameters:
        mapper - the mapping function
        Returns:
        a new future whose success result is flatMapped

        Creates a new future that will recover any potential Bad into a Good using the supplied function.
        Parameters:
        fn - recovery function
        Returns:
        a new future that completes with a Good, possibly as a result of a recovery

      • recoverWith

        default <C> OrFuture<G,C> recoverWith(Function<? super B,? extends OrFuture<? extends G,? extends C>> fn)
        Creates a new future that will recover any potential Bad into the a new future.
        Type Parameters:
        C - the failure type of the new future
        Parameters:
        fn - the recovery function
        Returns:
        a new future whose value is the result of a recovery if this future completes with a Bad

      • transform

        default <H,C> OrFuture<H,C> transform(Function<? super G,? extends H> s,
                                      Function<? super B,? extends C> f)
        Creates a new future by
        - applying the 's' function to the Good value if this future completes with a Good
        - applying the 'f' function to the Bad value if this future completes with a Bad
        Type Parameters:
        H - the success type of the new future
        C - the failure type of the new future
        Parameters:
        s - the function to use to transform the success value of this future
        f - the function to use to transform the failure value of this future
        Returns:
        a new future with a transformed value

      • validatedBy

        static <F,G,ERR> OrFuture<Vector<G>,Every<ERR>> validatedBy(Iterable<? extends F> iterable,
                                                            Function<? super F,? extends OrFuture<? extends G,? extends Every<? extends ERR>>> f)
        Maps an iterable of Fs into OrFutures of type OrFuture<G, EVERY<ERR>> (where EVERY is some subtype of Every) using the passed function f, then combines the resulting OrFutures into a single OrFuture of type OrFuture<Vector<G>, Every<ERR>>.

        Note: the process implemented by this method is sometimes called a "traverse".

        Type Parameters:
        F - the type of the original iterable to validate
        G - the Good type of the resulting Or
        ERR - the Bad type of the resulting Or
        Parameters:
        iterable - the iterable to validate
        f - the validation function
        Returns:
        an Or of all the success values or of all the errors

      • validatedBy

        static <F,G,A,I extends Iterable<? extends G>,ERR> OrFuture<I,Every<ERR>> validatedBy(Iterable<? extends F> iterable,
                                                                                      Function<? super F,? extends OrFuture<? extends G,? extends Every<? extends ERR>>> f,
                                                                                      Collector<? super G,A,I> collector)
        Maps an iterable of Fs into OrFutures of type OrFuture<G, EVERY<ERR>> (where EVERY is some subtype of Every) using the passed function f, then combines the resulting OrFutures into a single OrFuture of type OrFuture<COLL<G>, Every<ERR>> using a Collector to determine the wanted collection type COLL.

        Note: the process implemented by this method is sometimes called a "traverse".

        Type Parameters:
        F - the type of the original iterable to validate
        G - the Good type of the resulting Or
        A - the mutable accumulation type of the reduction operation of the collector
        I - the result type of the reduction operation
        ERR - the Bad type of the resulting Or
        Parameters:
        iterable - the iterable to validate
        f - the validation function
        collector - the collector producing the resulting collection
        Returns:
        an Or of all the success values or of all the errors

      • when

        @SafeVarargs
static <G,ERR> OrFuture<G,Every<ERR>> when(OrFuture<? extends G,? extends Every<? extends ERR>> or,
                                                        Function<? super G,? extends Validation<ERR>>... validations)
        Enables further validation on an existing accumulating OrFuture by passing validation functions.
        Type Parameters:
        G - the Good type of the argument OrFuture
        ERR - the type of the error message contained in the accumulating failure
        Parameters:
        or - the accumulating OrFuture
        validations - the validation functions
        Returns:
        the original or if it passed all validations or a Bad with all failures

      • withGood

        static <A,B,ERR,RESULT> OrFuture<RESULT,Every<ERR>> withGood(OrFuture<? extends A,? extends Every<? extends ERR>> fa,
                                                             OrFuture<? extends B,? extends Every<? extends ERR>> fb,
                                                             BiFunction<? super A,? super B,? extends RESULT> function)
        Combines two accumulating OrFutures into a single one using the given function. The resulting OrFuture will complete with a Good if both OrFutures complete with Goods, otherwise it will complete with a Bad containing every error in the Bads.
        Type Parameters:
        A - the success type
        B - the success type
        ERR - the error type of the OrFutures
        RESULT - the success type of the resulting OrFuture
        Parameters:
        fa - the first OrFuture to combine
        fb - the second OrFuture to combine
        function - the function combining the OrFutures
        Returns:
        an OrFuture that completes with a Good if both OrFutures completed with Goods, otherwise completes with a Bad containing every error.

      • combined

        static <G,ERR> OrFuture<Vector<G>,Every<ERR>> combined(Iterable<? extends OrFuture<? extends G,? extends Every<? extends ERR>>> input)
        Combines an Iterable of OrFutures of type OrFuture<G, EVERY<ERR>> (where EVERY is some subtype of Every) into a single OrFuture of type OrFuture<Vector<G>, Every<ERR>>.
        Type Parameters:
        G - the success type
        ERR - the failure type
        Parameters:
        input - the iterable containing OrFutures to combine
        Returns:
        an OrFuture that completes with all the success values or with all the errors

      • combined

        static <G,ERR,A,I extends Iterable<? extends G>> OrFuture<I,Every<ERR>> combined(Iterable<? extends OrFuture<? extends G,? extends Every<? extends ERR>>> input,
                                                                                 Collector<? super G,A,I> collector)
        Combines an Iterable of OrFutures of type OrFuture<G, EVERY<ERR>> (where EVERY is some subtype of Every) into a single OrFuture of type OrFuture<COLL<G>, Every<ERR>> using a Collector to determine the wanted collection type COLL.
        Type Parameters:
        G - the success type
        A - the mutable accumulation type of the reduction operation of the collector
        ERR - the failure type
        I - the resulting success iterable type
        Parameters:
        input - the iterable containing OrFutures to combine
        collector - the collector producing the resulting collection
        Returns:
        an OrFuture that completes with all the success values or with all the errors

      • zip

        static <A,B,ERR> OrFuture<Tuple2<A,B>,Every<ERR>> zip(OrFuture<? extends A,? extends Every<? extends ERR>> a,
                                                      OrFuture<? extends B,? extends Every<? extends ERR>> b)
        Zips two accumulating OrFutures together. If both complete with Goods, returns an OrFuture that completes with a Good tuple containing both original Good values. Otherwise returns an OrFuture that completes with a Bad containing every error message.
        Type Parameters:
        A - the success type
        B - the success type
        ERR - the error type of the accumulating OrFutures
        Parameters:
        a - the first OrFuture to zip
        b - the second OrFuture to zip
        Returns:
        an OrFuture that completes with a Good of type Tuple2 if both OrFutures completed with Goods, otherwise returns an OrFuture that completes with a Bad containing every error.

      • zip3

        static <A,B,C,ERR> OrFuture<Tuple3<A,B,C>,Every<ERR>> zip3(OrFuture<? extends A,? extends Every<? extends ERR>> a,
                                                           OrFuture<? extends B,? extends Every<? extends ERR>> b,
                                                           OrFuture<? extends C,? extends Every<? extends ERR>> c)
